verses.kjv: In that day there shall be a fountain opened to the house of David and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem for sin and for uncleanness.
verses.web: “In that day there will be a spring opened to David’s house and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem, for sin and for uncleanness.
verses.ct: On that day, a fountain will be opened for the house of David and the people of Jerusalem — a fountain to wash away sin and uncleanness.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass in that day, saith the LORD of hosts, that I will cut off the names of the idols out of the land, and they shall no more be remembered: and also I will cause the prophets and the unclean spirit to pass out of the land.
verses.web: It will come to pass in that day, says LORD of Armies, that I will cut off the names of the idols out of the land, and they will be remembered no more. I will also cause the prophets and the spirit of impurity to pass out of the land.
verses.ct: "On that day," declares the LORD of Hosts, "I will wipe out the very names of the idols from the land so that no one even remembers them. I will also rid the land of false prophets and the unclean spirit that drives them."

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, that when any shall yet prophesy, then his father and his mother that begat him shall say unto him, Thou shalt not live; for thou speakest lies in the name of the LORD: and his father and his mother that begat him shall thrust him through when he prophesieth.
verses.web: It will happen that, when anyone still prophesies, then his father and his mother who bore him will tell him, ‘You must die, because you speak lies in LORD’s name;’ and his father and his mother who bore him will stab him when he prophesies.
verses.ct: If anyone still claims to prophesy, his own father and mother who gave him life will say to him, "You deserve to die, because you speak lies in the name of the LORD." His own parents will stab him for prophesying.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass in that day, that the prophets shall be ashamed every one of his vision, when he hath prophesied; neither shall they wear a rough garment to deceive:
verses.web: It will happen in that day, that the prophets will each be ashamed of his vision, when he prophesies; neither will they wear a hairy mantle to deceive:
verses.ct: On that day, every false prophet will be ashamed of the visions he claimed to see. They won't even put on a prophet's rough cloak anymore to trick people.

verses.kjv: But he shall say, I am no prophet, I am an husbandman; for man taught me to keep cattle from my youth.
verses.web: but he will say, ‘I am no prophet, I am a tiller of the ground; for I have been made a bondservant from my youth.’
verses.ct: Instead, each one will say, "I'm no prophet — I'm just a farmer. I've been working the land since I was young."

verses.kjv: And one shall say unto him, What are these wounds in thine hands? Then he shall answer, Those with which I was wounded in the house of my friends.
verses.web: One will say to him, ‘What are these wounds between your arms?’ Then he will answer, ‘Those with which I was wounded in the house of my friends.’
verses.ct: If someone asks him, "Then what are these wounds on your body?" he'll answer, "I got these at the house of my friends."

verses.kjv: Awake, O sword, against my shepherd, and against the man that is my fellow, saith the LORD of hosts: smite the shepherd, and the sheep shall be scattered: and I will turn mine hand upon the little ones.
verses.web: “Awake, sword, against my shepherd, and against the man who is close to me,” says LORD of Armies. “Strike the shepherd, and the sheep will be scattered; and I will turn my hand against the little ones.
verses.ct: "Wake up, sword! Strike my shepherd — the man who stands closest to me," declares the LORD of Hosts. "Strike the shepherd, and the sheep will scatter. Then I will turn my hand against the little ones."

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, that in all the land, saith the LORD, two parts therein shall be cut off and die; but the third shall be left therein.
verses.web: It shall happen that in all the land,” says LORD, “two parts in it will be cut off and die; but the third will be left in it.
verses.ct: "Across the whole land," declares the LORD, "2 out of every 3 will be cut down and die. But a third will survive."

verses.kjv: And I will bring the third part through the fire, and will refine them as silver is refined, and will try them as gold is tried: they shall call on my name, and I will hear them: I will say, It is my people: and they shall say, The LORD is my God.
verses.web: I will bring the third part into the fire, and will refine them as silver is refined, and will test them like gold is tested. They will call on my name, and I will hear them. I will say, ‘It is my people;’ and they will say, ‘LORD is my God.’ ”
verses.ct: "I will put that surviving third through the fire. I will refine them the way silver is refined and test them the way gold is tested. They will call on my name, and I will answer them. I will say, 'These are my people,' and they will say, 'The LORD is my God.'"
